title: Please try harder to support those who are keeping opinion and humour alive on television
text:
The strange case of Naga Munchetty and the ECU brought back to me, in all its shivering glory, the most depressing and frustrating experience of my broadcasting year so far. (I might have said “entire broadcasting career”, but then I remembered I was once knocked out of a televised poker contest by Roger De Courcey).

If you don’t know what the ECU is, you’re in good company. It seems to be a senior ruling body at the BBC, a sort of in-house Ofcom – and yet it’s possible, I have found, to spend over 10 years appearing on the BBC and never hear of this organisation until you fall foul of it. I spent most of the summer pacing around, like Butch and Sundance staring at the horizon, muttering: “Who...
description: The strange case of Naga Munchetty and the ECU brought back to me, in all its shivering glory, the most depressing and frustrating experience of my broadcasting year so far.
